abstract: Robust gains in almost all of JPMorgan Chase’s main businesses offered hope that the banking industry’s prospects were not as bad as feared.
snippet: Robust gains in almost all of JPMorgan Chase’s main businesses offered hope that the banking industry’s prospects were not as bad as feared.

headline.main: JPMorgan Posts $5.4 Billion Profit, Beating Estimates

abstract: Moelis & Company, the boutique merger advisory firm, continued its hiring spree on Thursday when it announced that a former JPMorgan Chase banker, Yorick Van Slingelandt, would join the operation in Dubai.
snippet: Moelis & Company, the boutique merger advisory firm, continued its hiring spree on Thursday when it announced that a former JPMorgan Chase banker, Yorick Van Slingelandt, would join the operation in Dubai.
lead_paragraph: Moelis & Company, the boutique merger advisory firm, continued its hiring spree on Thursday when it announced that a former JPMorgan Chase banker, Yorick Van Slingelandt, would join the operation in Dubai.

abstract: JPMorgan Chase named Larry Slaughter, a senior European banker, as a new co-head of investment banking for North America.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase named Larry Slaughter, a senior European banker, as a new co-head of investment banking for North America.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase on Thursday named Larry Slaughter, a senior European banker, as a new co-head of investment banking for North America, according to an internal memorandum obtained by DealBook.

headline.main: JPMorgan Names Co-Head of North America Investment Banking

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

lead_paragraph: JPMorgan’s Quarterly Profit Rises 13% | JPMorgan Chase reported on Thursday that its second-quarter profit rose 13 percent, to $5.4 billion, despite lingering mortgage troubles and weak trading results. The bank’s overall earnings of $1.28 a share easily beat analysts’ consensus estimate of $1.21 a share.

abstract: JPMorgan Chase’s strong earnings led bank stocks higher early on, but only JPMorgan managed to hold on to its gains.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase’s strong earnings led bank stocks higher early on, but only JPMorgan managed to hold on to its gains.
lead_paragraph: Bank earnings season has begun, a quarterly ritual in which the nation’s biggest banks emphasize their gains and explain away their losses on early-morning conference calls with analysts and investors. The stock market then gives its verdict.

headline.main: Bank Earnings Season Starts on a High Note
